title: Iqbal poetry focuses on spherical beliefs , optimum progress of society : Dr Steffen
content:
ISLAMABAD, Nov 9 (APP): Resident Representative of Hanns Seidel Foundation (HSF) in Pakistan Dr Steffen Kudella on Monday said that Allama Iqbal poetry focused on spherical beliefs and optimum development of the society.
Paying rich tribute to Allama Muhammad Iqbal on his143rd birth anniversary, he said Allama’s poetry and vision had big impacts for future generations of Pakistan and beyond.
Talking to APP, he urged upon the youth to seek guidance from Allama Iqbal’s thoughts to find solution to the issues being faced by the society in general and country at large to transform it into an welfare state.
About Allama Iqbal study in Germany, he expressed his sentiments: “My family house is located in Adelshofen which is a village near the city of Heidelberg.
Iqbal lived in Heidelberg during his Philosophy studies; the university there is one of Germany‘s best.”
Today we remember the national poet of #Pakistan Sir #AllamaIqbal on his 143rd birth anniversary.@HSF_Pakistan Head Dr. @Steffen_Kudella sheds light on the transformative power of Iqbal's poetry and his German connection in his #IqbalDay video remarks. pic.twitter.com/znRMdScBnx
